abstract: A roundup of the weekend’s media stories, including a deal between Disney and YouTube, NBC’s recent even-rougher patch and profiles of the Murdoch family.
snippet: A roundup of the weekend’s media stories, including a deal between Disney and YouTube, NBC’s recent even-rougher patch and profiles of the Murdoch family.
lead_paragraph: Bill Carter and Brian Stelter ask the question: With NBC trailing the other networks in prime-time ratings, is it possible that things could get worse for NBC? The answer is yes. “While every other network has generated a new hit, NBC, which needs hits the most, has not,” they write, noting that without the strong ratings of the N.F.L. on Sundays, “NBC would be struggling to stay out of fifth place in the ratings. Without football, NBC is now tied with the Spanish-language network Univision in those 18-49 ratings.” [NYT]
